letter.greeting: Dear Hackers, Musicians, Artists, and Engineers,
letter.paragraph1: Welcome to Hack Club's newest adventure. This spring we invite you to join us for Campfire, the world's biggest Game Jam happening simultaneously in 200 cities.
letter.paragraph2: Hack Club wants YOU to make a game this February 28th to March 1st.
letter.paragraph3: Don't consider yourself a game developer? No problem! We have tons of in-person workshops for you to make your first game, NO experience needed!
letter.paragraph4: Come participate to learn something new, make a game you're proud of, meet new friends and have tons of fun!

footer.tagline: made with love by Hack Club & Open Sauce
footer.description: Hack Club is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit and network of 60k+ technical high schoolers. We believe you learn best by building so we're creating community and providing grants so you can make awesome projects. In the past few years, we've partnered with GitHub to run
footer.closing: At Hack Club, students aren't just learning, they're shipping.

questions.question: What is a game jam?
questions.answer: A game jam is an event where you build a game from scratch in a short time period! It's all about creativity, teamwork, and having fun while learning new skills.

questions.question: Am I eligible?
questions.answer: If you're a high schooler (or younger, between ages 13-18), you're eligible! No prior experience required - just bring your enthusiasm and willingness to learn.

questions.question: But I've never hacked before!
questions.answer: Perfect! Game jams are designed for beginners. You'll have workshops, mentors, and teammates to help you every step of the way.

questions.question: All this, for free?
questions.answer: Yes! Everything is completely free - venue, food, swag, workshops, and prizes. Hack Club covers all costs so you can focus on creating.

questions.question: What do I need to bring?
questions.answer: Just bring yourself, a laptop, charger, and any personal items you need. We'll provide food, drinks, and everything else!

questions.question: Can I organize a Campfire in my city?
questions.answer: Absolutely! We're always looking for passionate organizers. If you're ready to bring the magic of game development to your community, we'd love to help.

questions.question: What are the steps to organizing?
questions.answer: First, apply through our organizer form. Then we'll guide you through venue booking, team building, workshop planning, and day-of coordination.

questions.question: Do we get funding?
questions.answer: Yes! Hack Club provides funding for venue, food, swag, and other event costs. We want to remove financial barriers for amazing events.

questions.question: Do we get volunteer hours?
questions.answer: Many schools accept organizing hours as community service. Check with your school's requirements - we can provide documentation.

questions.question: Can I join an organizing team?
questions.answer: Of course! Many cities have organizing teams. Reach out to organizers in your area or apply to join an existing team.
